creator: dsiembieda
title: How to Mix Plaster for Organic Forms "I Made it At The TechShop"
description: This Instructable describes how to mix plaster to create organic forms, specifically for making a mold, like for a plastic ant farm. It's geared towards those who prefer a less precise, more intuitive approach.
steps: Fill a bucket about 1/3 full with water.
Sift 8-10 cups of Plaster of Paris into the water, stirring gradually.
Continue stirring until the mixture becomes milky and clumps start to rise, achieving a milk-cream consistency.
Lay out boards, plastic, or wood as a base.
Pour an introductory layer of plaster, and let it settle for a few minutes.
Apply a second layer on top of the first, and repeat until the desired height is reached.
While the plaster is still wet, slice between the pieces with a knife or sharp edge to facilitate movement later.
Let the plaster dry for 24-48 hours.
Once dry, smooth any rough edges or undercuts with sandpaper.
Optionally, apply a layer of Shellac to preserve the mold for future use.
To Vacuform the mold, keep it on the platform and place into Vacuformer.
